rules.name: HUDLoggerUpdateInterval
rules.description: Overwrite HUD loggers update interval (gametick)

rules.name: antiSpamDisabled
rules.description: Disable spamming checks on players, including: chat message cooldown, creative item drop cooldown

rules.name: blockEventPacketRange
rules.description: Set the range where player will receive a block event packet after a block event fires successfully
extras: For piston the packet is used to render the piston movement animation. Decrease it to reduce client's lag

rules.name: blockPlacementIgnoreEntity
rules.description: Disable entity collision check before block placement, aka you can place blocks inside entities
extras: Works with creative mode players only

rules.name: cauldronBlockItemInteractFix
rules.description: Make player be able to place block against cauldron block with any filled level
extras: Affected Minecraft <= 1.16.x. This annoying behavior is already been fixed in 1.17+

rules.name: chunkTickSpeed
rules.description: Modify how often the chunk tick occurs per chunk per game tick
extras: The default value is 1. Set it to 0 to disables chunk ticks
Affected game phases: thunder, ice and snow, randomtick
With a value of n, in every chunk every game tick, climate things will tick n times, and randomtick will tick n * randomTickSpeed times per chunk section

rules.name: chunkUpdatePacketThreshold
rules.description: The threshold which the game will just send an chunk data packet if the amount of block changes is more than it
extras: Increasing this value might reduce network bandwidth usage, and boost client's fps if there are lots of tile entities in a chunk section with a lot of block changes
Set it to really high to simulate 1.16+ behavior, which is no chunk packet but only multiple block change packet
This rule is only available in <1.16

rules.name: clientSettingsLostOnRespawnFix
rules.description: Fixed stored client settings are not migrated from the old player entity during player respawn or entering end portal in the end
extras: So mods relies on client settings are always able to work correctly, e.g. serverside translation of this mod and worldedit mod

rules.name: commandLifeTime
rules.description: Enables /lifetime command to track entity lifetime and so on
extras: Useful for mob farm debugging etc.
validators: Can be limited to 'ops' only, or a custom permission level

rules.name: commandManipulate
rules.description: Enables /manipulate command for world related manipulation command
validators: Can be limited to 'ops' only, or a custom permission level

rules.name: commandRaid
rules.description: Enables /raid command for raid listing and tracking
validators: Can be limited to 'ops' only, or a custom permission level

rules.name: commandRaycast
rules.description: Enables /raycast command for debugging raycast
validators: Can be limited to 'ops' only, or a custom permission level

rules.name: commandRefresh
rules.description: Enables /refresh command for synchronizing your client to the server
validators: Can be limited to 'ops' only, or a custom permission level

rules.name: commandRemoveEntity
rules.description: Enables /removeentity command for directly erase target entities from the world
validators: Can be limited to 'ops' only, or a custom permission level

rules.name: commandSleep
rules.description: Enables /sleep command for creating lag
validators: Can be limited to 'ops' only, or a custom permission level

rules.name: commandSpeedTest
rules.description: Enables /speedtest command for network speed test
extras: You can change the maximum allowed test size with rule speedTestCommandMaxTestSize
validators: Can be limited to 'ops' only, or a custom permission level

rules.name: creativeNetherWaterPlacement
rules.description: Allow creative players place water via water bucket in nether
extras: Technically this rule applies to all ultrawarm dimensions

rules.name: creativeNoItemCooldown
rules.description: Remove the cooldown of items used by the creative players
extras: e.g. the 20gt cooldown after throwing an ender pearl

rules.name: creativeOpenContainerForcibly
rules.description: Allow creative players to open a container even if the container is blocked. e.g. for shulker box

rules.name: deobfuscateCrashReportStackTrace
rules.description: Deobfuscate stack traces in crash report

rules.name: dispenserNoItemCost
rules.description: Dispensers and droppers execute without having the itemstack inside decreased
extras: Either dropping and using items do not cost, but dropper transferring item still costs

rules.name: dispensersFireDragonBreath
rules.description: Dispenser can fire dragon breath bottle to create a dragon breath effect cloud

rules.name: enchantCommandNoRestriction
rules.description: Remove all enchantment restriction checks inside /enchant command

rules.name: entityBrainMemoryUnfreedFix
rules.description: Fix brain memory of living entity staying unfreed after the entity has been removed
extras: This could lead to a memory leak if living entities remember other and then get removed continuously and create an endless memory chain in their brains
Fixed MC-260605, using the same fix that Mojang implemented in 1.19.4-pre3

rules.name: entityMomentumLoss
rules.description: Set it to false to disable entity axis momentum cancellation if it's above 10m/gt when being loaded from disk

rules.name: entityPlacementIgnoreCollision
rules.description: Disable block and entity collision check during entity placement with items
extras: Affected items: armorstand, end crystal, all kinds of boat
Spawn egg items are not affected

rules.name: entityTrackerDistance
rules.description: The maximum horizontal chebyshev distance (in chunks) for the server to sync entities information to the client
extras: Basically this works as a "entity view distance", but will still be limited to the server view distance
Set it to a value not less than the server view distance to make the server sync all entities within the view distance to the client
Set it to a non-positive value to use vanilla logic
Requires chunk reloading to set the new rule value to entities

rules.name: entityTrackerInterval
rules.description: The time interval (in gametick) for the server to sync entities information to the client
extras: With a small number e.g. 1, entity information will be synced to the client every 1 gametick, resulting in less-likely client-side entity desync
Set it to a non-positive value to use vanilla logic
Requires chunk reloading to set the new rule value to entities

rules.name: explosionNoEntityInfluence
rules.description: Explosions won't affect any entity
extras: Influences here include damage, acceleration etc.

rules.name: explosionPacketRange
rules.description: Set the range where player will receive an explosion packet when an explosion happens

rules.name: failSoftBlockStateParsing
rules.description: Ignore invalid property keys/values in block state arguments used in e.g. /setblock command
extras: In vanilla invalid property keys/values cause command failure when parsing, this rule suppresses that
Useful during cross-version litematica schematic pasting etc.

rules.name: fakePlayerNamePrefix
rules.description: Add a name prefix for fake players spawned with /player command
extras: Set it to #none to stop adding a prefix
Which can prevent summoning fake player with illegal names and make player list look nicer

rules.name: fakePlayerNameSuffix
rules.description: Add a name suffix for fake players spawned with /player command
extras: Set it to #none to stop adding a suffix

rules.name: fakePlayerRemoteSpawning
rules.description: The permission requirement for spawning remotely a fake player with /player command
extras: Here "remotely" means spawning a fake player at more than 16m away, or in other dimension

rules.name: farmlandTrampledDisabled
rules.description: Disable farmland being able to be trampled into dirt by mobs

rules.name: fillCommandModeEnhance
rules.description: Enhance modes in the /fill command
extras: Add softreplace mode: Keep the block state of the original block as much as possible. You can use it to replace block type of stairs / slabs etc.
validators: Can be limited to 'ops' only, or a custom permission level

rules.name: fluidDestructionDisabled
rules.description: Disable block destruction by fluid flowing
extras: Fluid will just simple stopped at the state before destroying the block
It's useful to prevent liquid from accidentally flooding your redstone wiring in creative

rules.name: hopperCountersUnlimitedSpeed
rules.description: Make hopper pointing towards wool has infinity speed to suck in or transfer items with no cooldown
extras: Only works when hopperCounters option in Carpet Mod is on

rules.name: hopperNoItemCost
rules.description: Hopper with wool block on top outputs item infinitely without having its item decreased
extras: You can use /scounter command or subscribe to the scounter logger to track the amount of the output items
This rule is also the switch of the /scounter command

rules.name: instantCommandBlock
rules.description: Make command blocks on redstone ores execute command instantly instead of scheduling a 1gt delay TileTick event for execution
extras: Only affects normal command blocks

rules.name: itemEntitySkipMovementDisabled
rules.description: Removed the movement skipping mechanism when ticking of item entity
extras: Brings back <=1.13 item entity behavior, where item entities with low velocity on ground still tick movement every gt instead of every 4gt
Useful when you require precise item entity movement timing
Breaks related redstone devices, e.g. 2no2name's wireless redstone

rules.name: keepMobInLazyChunks
rules.description: The mobs in lazy chunks will not despawn
extras: This option only have effects between Minecraft 1.15 and 1.16

rules.name: largeBarrel
rules.description: The best storage block ever: Large barrel
extras: Two adjacent barrel blocks with their bottom side facing towards each other create a large barrel
The behavior and logic of large barrel is just like large chest

rules.name: lifeTimeTrackerConsidersMobcap
rules.description: Strategy for lifetime tracker to deal with mob that doesn't count towards mobcap
extras: true: Don't track mobs that don't count towards mobcap, and treat mobs as removal as soon as they don't affect mobcap e.g. right when they pick up some items. Good for mob farm designing
false: Tracks everything it can track and mark mobs as removal when they actually get removed. Good for raid testing Good for raid testing or non-mobfarms

rules.name: lightEngineMaxBatchSize
rules.description: Changes maximum light tasks batch size
extras: Allows for a higher light suppression tolerance
Setting it to 5 - Default limit defined by the game

rules.name: lightQueueLoggerSamplingDuration
rules.description: The sampling duration of light queue logger in game tick
extras: Affects all data except the queue size displayed in the logger

rules.name: lightUpdates
rules.description: Pause or disable light updates
extras: If set to suppressed, no light update can be executed which simulates light suppressor
If set to ignored, no light update can be scheduled. It's useful for creating light errors
If set to off, no light update can be scheduled or executed
[WARNING] If set to suppressed or off, new chunks cannot be loaded. Then if the server tries to load chunk for player movement or whatever reason the server will be stuck forever

rules.name: loggerMovement
rules.description: The switch / permission requirement of movement logger

rules.name: microTiming
rules.description: Enable the function of MicroTick logger
extras: Log and display redstone components actions, block updates and stacktrace with dye item
Use /log microTiming to start logging
Might impact the server performance when it's on
See description of rule microTimingDyeMarker for instructions of dye markers
[deprecated] Use wool blocks and end rods to mark blocks that need to be logged
[deprecated] End rods will detect block updates and redstone components will show their actions
[deprecated] - Observer, Piston, EndRod: pointing towards wool
[deprecated] - Repeater, Comparator, Rail, Button, etc.: placed on wool
[deprecated] Beside that, a universal block actions logging method is using EndRod on wool block to point on the block you want to log
[deprecated] Check rule microTimingTarget to see how to switch logging method

rules.name: microTimingDyeMarker
rules.description: Allow player to right click with dye item to mark a block to be logged by microTiming logger
extras: You need to subscribe to microTiming logger for marking or displaying blocks
Right click with the same dye to switch the marker to end rod mode with which block update information will be logged additionally. Right click again to remove the marker
Right click a marker with slime ball item to make it movable. It will move to the corresponding new position when the attaching block is moved by a piston
Use `/carpet microTimingDyeMarker clear` to remove all markers
You can create a named marker by using a renamed dye item. Marker name will be shown in logging message as well
You can see boxes at marked blocks with fabric-carpet installed on your client. With carpet-tis-addition installed the marker name could also be seen through blocks

rules.name: microTimingTarget
rules.description: Modify the way to specify events to be logged in microTiming logger. Events labelled with dye marker are always logged
extras: labelled: Logs events labelled with wool. Deprecated
in_range: Logs events within 32m of any player. Deprecated
all: Logs every event. Use with caution. Deprecated
marker_only: Logs event labelled with dye marker only. Use it with rule microTimingDyeMarker

rules.name: microTimingTickDivision
rules.description: Determine the way to divide game ticks
extras: world_timer: Divides at Overworld timer increment
player_action: Divides at the beginning of player action

rules.name: minecartFullDropBackport
rules.description: Backport the feature from Minecraft 1.19+ that minecart entity drops the full cart item on destroy
extras: Only works in Minecraft < 1.19

rules.name: minecartTakePassengerMinVelocity
rules.description: Determine the minimum required horizontal velocity (m/gt) for a minecart to pick up nearby entity as its passenger
extras: Set it to 0 to let minecart always take passenger no matter how fast it is, just like a boat
Set it to NaN to let minecart never takes passenger

rules.name: mobcapsDisplayIgnoreMisc
rules.description: Ignore mob type "misc" in carpet mobcaps displays
extras: Since it's useless: Nothing in misc category spawns, and it's ignored when calculating mobcap
Affects mobcaps logger and /spawn mobcap command

rules.name: oakBalloonPercent
rules.description: The chance for oak sapling top grow into a balloon oak (fancy_oak) in percent
extras: e.g. 0 means no balloon oak, 50 means 50% balloon oak, 100 means always balloon oak
Set it to -1 to disable the rule and use vanilla logic (10% balloon oak)

rules.name: observerNoDetection
rules.description: Stop observer from scheduling tile tick event after it receives a state update
extras: Basically this rule disables the detection functionality of observers

rules.name: opPlayerNoCheat
rules.description: Disable some command to prevent accidentally cheating
extras: Affects command list: /gamemode, /tp, /teleport, /give, /setblock, /summon

rules.name: optimizedFastEntityMovement
rules.description: Optimize fast entity movement by only checking block collisions on current moving axis
extras: Inspired by the fastMovingEntityOptimization rule in carpetmod112
Use with rule optimizedTNT to greatly improve performance in cannons

rules.name: optimizedHardHitBoxEntityCollision
rules.description: Optimize entity colliding with entities with hard hit box
extras: It uses an extra separate list to store entities, that have a hard hit box including boat and shulker, in a chunk
It reduces quite a lot of unnecessary iterating when an entity is moving and trying to search entities with hard hit box on the way,since the world is always not filled with boats and shulkers
Enable it before loading the chunk to make it work. ~20% performance boost in portal mob farms
Might not work with other mods that add new entities

rules.name: optimizedTNTHighPriority
rules.description: Use a Mixin injection with higher priority for carpet rule optimizedTNT
extras: So the rule optimizedTNT can overwrite lithium's explosion optimization
Of course rule optimizedTNT needs to be on for it to work

rules.name: persistentLoggerSubscription
rules.description: Remember the subscribed loggers as well as logging options of the player during server restart
extras: Only applies carpet's defaultLoggers rule at someone's first login
Logger subscriptions are saved in config/carpettisaddition/logger_subscriptions.json

rules.name: poiUpdates
rules.description: Whether block changes will cause POI to updates or not
extras: Set it to false to disable POI updates

rules.name: preciseEntityPlacement
rules.description: When placing / summoning entity with item, place the entity at the exact position of player's cursor target position
extras: Affected items: Spawn eggs, armorstand, ender crystal

rules.name: railDupingFix
rules.description: Disable rail duping using old school pushing lit powered or activator rail method

rules.name: redstoneDustRandomUpdateOrder
rules.description: Randomize the order for redstone dust to emit block updates
extras: It's useful to test if your contraption is locational or not
Does not work with rule fastRedstoneDust

rules.name: renewableDragonEgg
rules.description: Make dragon egg renewable
extras: When a dragon egg is in dragon breath effect cloud it has a possibility to absorb the effect cloud and "summon" a new dragon egg
Use with rule "dispensersFireDragonBreath" for more ease

rules.name: renewableDragonHead
rules.description: Ender dragon killed by charged creeper will drop dragon head

rules.name: renewableElytra
rules.description: Phantom killed by shulker will drops an elytra with given possibility
extras: Set it to 0 to disable

rules.name: repeaterHalfDelay
rules.description: Halve the delay of redstone repeaters upon a redstone ore
extras: The delay will change from 2, 4, 6 or 8 game tick instead of 1, 2, 3 or 4 game tick

rules.name: sandDupingFix
rules.description: Disable sand and other gravity block duping using end portal
extras: Gravity block includes sand, anvil, dragon egg and so on
In sand dupers sand will only get teleported to the other dimension

rules.name: snowMeltMinLightLevel
rules.description: The minimum light level allowed for snow to melt
extras: In vanilla the value is 12, which means snow will melt when the light level >=12 when random ticked
Set it to 0 to melt all annoying snow on your builds
Set it to the same level as the minimum light level for snow to not fall on block (light level 10) to easily test if your build is snow-proof with light or not
You can modify gamerule randomTickSpeed to speed up the melting progress, or modify carpet rule chunkTickSpeed to speed up the snowfall progress

rules.name: speedTestCommandMaxTestSize
rules.description: The max test size in MiB when using the /speedtest command for network speed test

rules.name: stopCommandDoubleConfirmation
rules.description: Add a double confirmation for /stop command to prevent stopping server accidentally
extras: You need to enter /stop twice within 1 minute to stop the server
This mechanics only works for players

rules.name: structureBlockDoNotPreserveFluid
rules.description: Structure block do not preserve existed fluid when placing waterlogged-able blocks
extras: Has a side effect of suppressing bug MC-130584 happening

rules.name: structureBlockLimit
rules.description: Overwrite the size limit of structure block
extras: Relative position might display wrongly on client side if it's larger than 32

rules.name: structureBlockOutlineDistance
rules.description: Customizable Structure Block outline render distance
extras: Required on client to work properly

rules.name: syncServerMsptMetricsData
rules.description: Sync server's mspt metrics data to the client, so players can see that in the debug screen with F3 + ALT
extras: Carpet TIS Addition is required to be installed on the client

rules.name: synchronizedLightThread
rules.description: Synchronize lighting thread with the server thread
extras: so the light thread will not lag behind the main thread and get desynchronized
The server will wait until all lighting tasks to be done at the beginning of each world ticking
With this rule you can safely /tick warp without potential light suppression or lighting desynchronization

rules.name: tileTickLimit
rules.description: Modify the limit of executed tile tick events per game tick

rules.name: tiscmNetworkProtocol
rules.description: The switch of the TISCM network protocol

rules.name: tntDupingFix
rules.description: Disable TNT, carpet and part of rail dupers
extras: Attachment block update based dupers will do nothing and redstone component update based dupers can no longer keep their duped block
Dupe bad dig good

rules.name: tntFuseDuration
rules.description: Overwrite the default fuse duration of TNT
extras: This might also affect the fuse duration of TNT ignited in explosion

rules.name: tntIgnoreRedstoneSignal
rules.description: Prevent TNT blocks from being ignited from redstone
extras: You can still use explosion etc. to ignite a tnt

rules.name: tooledTNT
rules.description: Tools on the player's main hand is applied to item dropping during the explosion caused by the player
extras: So you can ignite TNT to harvest blocks that require specific tool or enchantment as long as you are holding the right tool
For example, you can harvest ice with silk touch pickaxe, or harvest grass with shears
It also works for any other living entities beside player
Technically this rule applies the main hand item of the causing entity onto the loot table builder during the explosion

rules.name: totallyNoBlockUpdate
rules.description: Disable all block updates and state updates

rules.name: toughWitherRose
rules.description: Birth from death, wither rose is tough enough to be planted on any surface
extras: This rule removes all placement requirement of wither rose block, which means you're able to place wither rose at anywhere
It's useful when you want to play around with update suppressed wither roses for wither skeleton farms

rules.name: turtleEggTrampledDisabled
rules.description: Disable turtle egg trampled to broken

rules.name: ultraSecretSetting
rules.description: qOf DSh hwg ORRWHW Cb

rules.name: undeadDontBurnInSunlight
rules.description: Prevent undead creatures burning in sunlight
extras: Their helmets will still get damaged in sunlight though

rules.name: updateSuppressionSimulator
rules.description: Activator / Powered rail on a lapis ore simulates an update suppressor
extras: Right before a powered activator / powered rail on a lapis ore setting its powered state to false, throw the given JVM throwable
false: rule disabled; true: rule enable and use StackOverflowError; others: feature enable and use given throwable

rules.name: visualizeProjectileLoggerEnabled
rules.description: Enable visualize projectile logger
extras: Try /log projectiles visualize

rules.name: voidDamageAmount
rules.description: Modify the amount of void damage

rules.name: voidDamageIgnorePlayer
rules.description: Prevent players from taking void damage
extras: Completely harmless void for players, yay!

rules.name: voidRelatedAltitude
rules.description: Modify the related altitude between the bottom of the world and the void where entities will receive void damages

rules.name: witherSpawnedSoundDisabled
rules.description: Disable the wither spawned sound emitted when a wither fully reset its health after summoned

rules.name: xpTrackingDistance
rules.description: Overwrite the tracking distance of xp orb
extras: Change it to 0 to disable tracking

rules.name: yeetUpdateSuppressionCrash
rules.description: Prevent the server from crashing due to StackOverflowError, OutOfMemoryError or ClassCastException
extras: Do the same thing as fabric carpet's updateSuppressionCrashFix rule, but with more information
